Posts.Content: loopyloulee wrote: Hey!  I am just curious is there anyone who originally had curly hair that grew back straight?  Or was it just curlier? Lou Dx 10/12/2007, <1cm, Grade 1, 1/0 nodes, ER+/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Anyone with Curly hair that grew back straight? loopyloulee Myrajuc

Posts.Content: Dec 14, 2007 11:50AM loopyloulee wrote: Wow!  I thought that it might be a possibility.  I guess I will have to wait and see!  I lost all mine last night.  Pulled the clumps out in the shower, then buzzed it, and shaved it!  My head is not lumpy, so it looks ok!  Last treatment is January 28th, so I have a while to wait and see. thanks to all who responded so far. Lou
Posts.Title: Anyone with Curly hair that grew back straight? loopyloulee Myrajuc

Posts.Content: Nov 21, 2007 09:57AM loopyloulee wrote: Hi!  I start Monday of next week also, 4 rounds of TC.  We will go through this together, and compare notes!  Good luck! Thanks Kaye, I can only hope mine goes as well as your did! Lou
Posts.Title: TC Chemo coming up-please share with me mikim auntienance

Posts.Content: Nov 30, 2007 12:11PM loopyloulee wrote: Hi Amy!  Well, I can say that I don't like this at all!  I just feel crappy!  I need to eat regularly, and small quantities to feel better.  I have been getting stomache pains and all that go along with it.  I won't go into details!  I know there are many out there way worse off than I am so I will not complain, too much!  Let's just say I can't wait for the end of this ordeal. Lou
Posts.Title: TC Chemo coming up-please share with me mikim auntienance

Posts.Content: Oct 2, 2008 08:15AM loopyloulee wrote: Hi All!  I stumbled upon this thread and thought I'd join in!  I finished Chemo on 1/24/08 and now have about 3 inches of hair!  Of course it is so curly that it looks much shorter.  I call myself the poodle now!  Nancy D, I too had curly hair and had the delusion that it would be straight, especially because at first, it was straight and looked kind of chic.  Well it is now curlier than it ever was!  But everyone loves it.  I'm sure you'll understand when I say that I am not so sure I like it, I always wanted straight hair too.  The grass is always greener on the other side of the street!  But you know I have hair again!  yeah!!  I started to go with out my wigs in public, about 8 weeks after my last chemo!  I was still quite bald looking, but a good friend had her head shaved as a fund raiser to support childrens cancer, and she went topless.  So I said what the heck!  Those of you just about to lose hair, please have it cut prior to the actual loss.  I did not, because my doctor said I would not lose my hair.  It was a real shock, when I had that awful itch, and knew it had to be washed and would proabably all come out.  It was terrible.  I looked like a fall out victim.  I pulled out clumps in the shower, but not all of it came out.  My hubby then buzzed my head, and I shaved it!  So if you have long hair, get it cut!  it will be ffar less traumatic. Well, good luck to all! Lou
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2007 01:16PM loopyloulee wrote: Bring a good book to read!  I just try to keep a positive attitude at all times.  I did have a good cry when the hair went, but bounced right back.  Yesterday was my second treatment, and I feel a lot better than I did last time.  You will get through this!  Good luck!
Posts.Title: TC Chemo coming up-please share with me mikim auntienance

Posts.Content: Oct 14, 2011 09:48AM loopyloulee wrote: Hey MamaV!  I was also surprised when my former curly hair laid flat against my head!  I thought that it would grow back straight!  Did not happen.  That flat hair turned into the curliest hair ever.  It was insanely tight and grew outward!  It did go back to my normal hair eventually!  I am 4 years out now, and my hair is gorgeous!  good luck!
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2008 03:14PM loopyloulee wrote: Hey Valerie, My hair was always pretty curly.  When it grew back it was straight at first!  I was hopeful that it would stay that way.  Now I look like a poodle!  Of course everyone is different, but I bet it gets that curl soon!  I had last tx at end of January, and still did not have a lot of hair in mid May, now I have about 3 inches or more, but you cannot tell, because it is so curly!  I think you have a way to go, so don't worry yet! Lou
Posts.Title: Hair Hair Hair - Another question Deen Krose53

Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2007 07:57AM loopyloulee wrote: Hi all!  Started yesterday!  I am feeling a little nauseous and bloated today.  On top of it all, I have a allergy thing happening so my nose is running and stuffed at the same time.  Drinking lots and lots of water.  Slept ok last night!  Well here we go!  I'm glad we can go through this together! Lou
Posts.Title: TC Chemo coming up-please share with me mikim auntienance

Posts.Content: Dec 6, 2007 03:08PM loopyloulee wrote: Hi All!  Well I feel great!  Now!  I actually started feeling really good on Sunday!  So 6 days after treatment.  I have to say that I was functioning, I came to work every day, and went through the motions.  As long as I took the compezine every 4 hours and ate small meals I existed.  I did not need a stool softener, had the opposite effect, but never to a degree where I had to take anything.  Taste buds are still screwed, but anyone who is new, you can do this!!!!  It feels great to feel great again!  Well, the 17th is my second one!  I should fell terrific by then! Good luck all! Lou
Posts.Title: TC Chemo coming up-please share with me mikim auntienance

Posts.Content: Dec 18, 2007 10:06AM loopyloulee wrote: Hi Dianne!  I worked the entire time.  I felt crappy, and was happy to go home that first week, but I was there.  About day 6 I felt better.  Then I really did feel ok the rest of the time.  Make sure you get your wig or head gear.  by Day 17, ny head hurt so bad and the hair came out in clumps!!!  May not happen to you, but it is best to be prepared! Lou
